protocol_name: Bystander Receptor Blockade:  IFNλR1, TNFRSF1A, ICAM-1 and FAS
protocol_name_html: Bystander Receptor Blockade:  IFNλR1, TNFRSF1A, ICAM-1 and FAS
description: This protocol describes the use of neutralizing antibodies to block receptrs for assessing involvement in bystander killing by BiTE®-activated T cells.
protocol_affiliation: Department of Oncology Research, Amgen Inc.
manuscript_citation: Ross SL, Sherman M, McElroy PL, Lofgren JA, Moody G, Baeuerle PA, Coxon A, Arvedson T, Bispecific T cell engager (BiTE) antibody constructs can mediate bystander tumor cell killing. PLoS ONE 12(8). doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0183390

components.data: Day 1:  Combine EGFR+ (NUGC4) + T cells (10:1 E:T) +/- 100 pM EGFR BiTE® in T75 flask. Please refer to BiTE® bystander T cell dependent cellular cytotoxicity (TDCC) assay protocol (Step 5 – TDCC assay using BiTE®-activated T cells).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Day 1:  Combine EGFR+ (NUGC4) + T cells (10:1 E:T) +/- 100 pM EGFR BiTE® in T75 flask. Please refer to BiTE® bystander T cell dependent cellular cytotoxicity (TDCC) assay protocol (Step 5 – TDCC assay using BiTE®-activated T cells).

components.data: Prepare BiTE®-activated and control T cells in bulk
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Prepare BiTE®-activated and control T cells in bulk

components.data: Day 1:  Prepare EGFR- (SW620) cells by plating 10,000 cells/well in ViewPlate-96 black plates. Please refer to BiTE® T cell-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (TDCC) assay protocol (Step 5 – prepare target cells). If blocking ICAM-1 or FAS, treat cells +/- 10ng/ml IFNγ and 5ng/ml TNFα for 24 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Day 1:  Prepare EGFR- (SW620) cells by plating 10,000 cells/well in ViewPlate-96 black plates. Please refer to BiTE® T cell-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (TDCC) assay protocol (Step 5 – prepare target cells). If blocking ICAM-1 or FAS, treat cells +/- 10ng/ml IFNγ and 5ng/ml TNFα for 24 hours.

components.data: Day 2:  Harvest bulk BiTE®-activated and control T cells prepared in step 2. Please refer to BiTE® bystander T cell dependent cellular cytotoxicity (TDCC) assay protocol (Step 5 – TDCC assay using BiTE®-activated T cells). Resuspend cells at 2x10e6 cells/ml (will use 50 µl/well = 100,000 cells/well)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Day 2:  Harvest bulk BiTE®-activated and control T cells prepared in step 2. Please refer to BiTE® bystander T cell dependent cellular cytotoxicity (TDCC) assay protocol (Step 5 – TDCC assay using BiTE®-activated T cells). Resuspend cells at 2x10e6 cells/ml (will use 50 µl/well = 100,000 cells/well)

components.data: Prepare 2X blocking antibody solutions in Assay Medium
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Prepare 2X blocking antibody solutions in Assay Medium

components.data:
Day 2:

  1. Remove medium from all wells
  2. Add 50 µl/well 2X control or blocking antibody to designated wells; incubate for 1 hour at 37°C
  3. Add 50 µl/well control or activated T cells prepared in Step 4 to designated wells (for E:T of 10:1, use 2x10e6 cells/ml; 50 µl = 100,000 cells/well). Note: BiTE® dilutions can be added to T cells prior to adding to assay plate.
  4. As a control for FAS activation, add 50 µl/well Assay Medium + 50 µl/well 2X FAS activating antibody to designated wells
  5. Incubate plates for 24 hours at 37°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Day 2:

  1. Remove medium from all wells
  2. Add 50 µl/well 2X control or blocking antibody to designated wells; incubate for 1 hour at 37°C
  3. Add 50 µl/well control or activated T cells prepared in Step 4 to designated wells (for E:T of 10:1, use 2x10e6 cells/ml; 50 µl = 100,000 cells/well). Note: BiTE® dilutions can be added to T cells prior to adding to assay plate.
  4. As a control for FAS activation, add 50 µl/well Assay Medium + 50 µl/well 2X FAS activating antibody to designated wells
  5. Incubate plates for 24 hours at 37°C

components.data: Day 3:  Fix cells, stain nuclei with Hoechst nuclear dye and count 16 10X fields on ArrayScan using Target Activation bioapplication. Please refer to BiTE® T cell-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (TDCC) assay protocol (Step 8 – Cytotoxicity assay).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Day 3:  Fix cells, stain nuclei with Hoechst nuclear dye and count 16 10X fields on ArrayScan using Target Activation bioapplication. Please refer to BiTE® T cell-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (TDCC) assay protocol (Step 8 – Cytotoxicity assay).
